Do not be allured by the Veuve Clicquot tasting at their champagne house in Reims as I was. Ive traveled the world and tasted wine in places like Napa, Tuscany, etc. but Ive never had such a poor experience as I did at Veuve Clicquot so I feel compelled to leave a review. I booked a one-hour long rosé tasting for 60 euro a person. First, they took us on a 30-minute cellar tour without any wine. Then, we moved to a room for two tastings and a small cheese pairing plate. After the guides explanation and champagne being poured, we had only 15 minutes to enjoy our champagne and cheese. We were prohibited from taking our champagne outside the tasting room, which is unusual Taittinger allowed us to finish our tasting in the reception area. At our table, people from Norway and Australia were just as confused. With two minutes to spear, we were told to drink our champagne quickly and vacate the room because our time was up  mind you after you continue to read my review this was the LAST tasting of the day. The rushed tasting led us to seek a glass of champagne on the terrace, as suggested by our tour guide after suggesting that we visit the gift shop. After buying a 70 bottle of vintage champagne and two custom Veuve Clicquot glasses, we were turned away from the terrace because it was closing in 15 minutes, despite it being half full. We were told to come back the next day. This was so condescending as I  traveled from miles away and cant easily return the next day.This treatment of paying customers is unacceptable. My day in Reims was ruined, and I left in tears. My advice: avoid Veuve Clicquot and find a smaller champagne house that values its visitors. I will never spend a dime on Veuve Clicquot again in my lifetimeRead more
